commit.message:
[GH#46] Show User, Hostname, & Time Above Password Input

Add a `show-sys-info` config option that renders `<user>@<hostname>` &
`HH:MM` labels above the password input when enabled. The label text is
currently fixed, but the font, size, spacing, & color are customizable.

[GH#46] Show User, Hostname, & Time Above Password Input

Add a `show-sys-info` config option that renders `<user>@<hostname>` &
`HH:MM` labels above the password input when enabled. The label text is
currently fixed, but the font, size, spacing, & color are customizable.

last items in the focused list.

commit.message:
[GH#32] Add Ability to Switch Between DE/WM Sessions

A new `session-key` configuration option has been added. When pressed
with the `mod-key`, mini greeter will switch to the next session in
LightDM's session list & display it under the password input.

`user-session` no longer needs to be set in `lightdm.conf`, but we
pre-select it if it is a valid session.

Add a `FocusRing` type & related functions for keeping a selection
within a list & looping around at the ends.

verification.payload:
tree 565c1ddbe8a0f1c16fe89a02ce5d8aa993cac40e
parent 69a1cb0fee3d2ce2a38bc147d9eb92d66e2b79bc
author Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1633410593 -0400
committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1633410593 -0400

[GH#32] Add Ability to Switch Between DE/WM Sessions

A new `session-key` configuration option has been added. When pressed
with the `mod-key`, mini greeter will switch to the next session in
LightDM's session list & display it under the password input.

`user-session` no longer needs to be set in `lightdm.conf`, but we
pre-select it if it is a valid session.

Add a `FocusRing` type & related functions for keeping a selection
within a list & looping around at the ends.

commit.message:
[GH#22][GH#75] Make Configuration Values Optional

Modify the configuration parsing code in `config.c` to make all options
beside `greeter.user` optional. If these are invalid or not present in
the configuration file, we log a message & fallback to their initial
values.

verification.payload:
tree 8cafda734aa614a472702975a0015bc0af6661da
parent 8a8c440d24566ce7d01defc5389bcdcc3cf102f9
author Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1632378250 -0400
committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1632378250 -0400

[GH#22][GH#75] Make Configuration Values Optional

Modify the configuration parsing code in `config.c` to make all options
beside `greeter.user` optional. If these are invalid or not present in
the configuration file, we log a message & fallback to their initial
values.

commit.message:
[GH#70] Fix Crash When password-alignment Is Missing

Fix a crash caused by trying to free() a static string constant returned
by `parse_greeter_string`. To prevent this, we now create a duplicate of
the fallback value when the configuration option is missing.

Fixes GH#70

verification.payload:
tree 6e00a759e495f58b1ceb1f6af4563a945ca86a28
parent e8ce8ad4cc5787264478065d378c91c3f9587e20

committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1614644331 -0500

[GH#70] Fix Crash When password-alignment Is Missing

Fix a crash caused by trying to free() a static string constant returned
by `parse_greeter_string`. To prevent this, we now create a duplicate of
the fallback value when the configuration option is missing.

Fixes GH#70

commit.message:
[GH#69] Add Ability to Center Password Input Text

Add a new possible `"center"` value to the `password-alignment` option,
specifying that the text in the password input should be centered,
instead of left- or right-aligned.

Closes GH#69

commit.message:
[GH#67] Add Option for Setting Password Input Border Radius

Add a new `password-border-radius` option to the `greeter-theme` section
of the config file. This can be any valid CSS size(`0`, `0.25rem`,
`5px`, etc) & controls the border-radius property of the password input.

Closes GH#67

commit.message:
[GH#68] Add Ability to Set Password Mask Character

Add a new `password-character` option to the `greeter-theme` section of
the configuration file. This allows users to modify the character that
is displayed in the input when they type their password.

A value of -1 means to use the default bullet, 0 means to display
nothing, & any other value sets the password mask character. Even emojis
work if your font supports them!

Closes GH#68

verification.payload:
tree 759ff9031d6eb321ad20cf7c1aadb1d768e55c1c
parent 99d21c5c5b9f73f79e618d32e8a540a5422b8fe8

committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1613078779 -0500

[GH#68] Add Ability to Set Password Mask Character

Add a new `password-character` option to the `greeter-theme` section of
the configuration file. This allows users to modify the character that
is displayed in the input when they type their password.

A value of -1 means to use the default bullet, 0 means to display
nothing, & any other value sets the password mask character. Even emojis
work if your font supports them!

Closes GH#68

commit.message:
Fix Config Module's Integer Parsing Function

Fix the config module's parse_greeter_integer function so it actually
uses the passed group & key names. This wasn't causing a bug yet, as the
function was only being used to parse the group & key that was hardcoded
into the function definition.

verification.payload:
tree fa0dfc9e98cf9fed0e370167f5ae394bc044bafe
parent 425b8d360d434b39508a024145f5073cf014136a
author Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1613075898 -0500
committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1613075898 -0500

Fix Config Module's Integer Parsing Function

Fix the config module's parse_greeter_integer function so it actually
uses the passed group & key names. This wasn't causing a bug yet, as the
function was only being used to parse the group & key that was hardcoded
into the function definition.

commit.message:
[#1687][GH#37] Disable the Password Input While Authenticating

Fix a bug causing LightDM to crash when the password was submitted while
a previous authentication was in progress. Disable the password input
when the password is submitted and wait until the authentication attempt
succeeds or fails to clear & re-enable it.

Add a new password_callback_id field to the App type to store the signal
handler ID for the handle_password callback on the password_input's
activate signal. This is populated when the app is initialized and the
initial signal handler is connected. When a password is submitted, we
use the field value to disconnect the handler from the signal. When
authentication succeeds or fails, we re-add the handler and store the
new handler ID in the field.

Closes #1687
Closes GH#37

verification.payload:
tree 0f9ced592377877905a1fc5b3d6c9bd5b3db4c0f
parent fa0a828f217931190fb13bedaee3a64603f9a844
author Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1586235682 -0400
committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1586235682 -0400

[#1687][GH#37] Disable the Password Input While Authenticating

Fix a bug causing LightDM to crash when the password was submitted while
a previous authentication was in progress. Disable the password input
when the password is submitted and wait until the authentication attempt
succeeds or fails to clear & re-enable it.

Add a new password_callback_id field to the App type to store the signal
handler ID for the handle_password callback on the password_input's
activate signal. This is populated when the app is initialized and the
initial signal handler is connected. When a password is submitted, we
use the field value to disconnect the handler from the signal. When
authentication succeeds or fails, we re-add the handler and store the
new handler ID in the field.

Closes #1687
Closes GH#37

commit.message:
[#GH52] Add Option for Setting Password Input Width

Add a new `password-input-width` option to the `greeter` section of the
config file. This can be a negative number to defer to GTK's default
input width, or a positive number to suggest to GTK the number of
characters that should fit into the input.

Note: GTK may decide to render a narrower input.

Add a new parse_greeter_integer helper function for parsing integers
from the configuration file. A fallback value will be used if the option
is invalid or not present.

Closes GH#52

verification.payload:
tree 7ae21a0994926ca319cac9a71062f9ff4a53d698
parent a803d3d5a90446b57e0358527e0eeacaadb2ffc4
author Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1586183264 -0400
committer Pavan Rikhi <pavan.rikhi@gmail.com> 1586183264 -0400

[#GH52] Add Option for Setting Password Input Width

Add a new `password-input-width` option to the `greeter` section of the
config file. This can be a negative number to defer to GTK's default
input width, or a positive number to suggest to GTK the number of
characters that should fit into the input.

Note: GTK may decide to render a narrower input.

Add a new parse_greeter_integer helper function for parsing integers
from the configuration file. A fallback value will be used if the option
is invalid or not present.

Closes GH#52
